content:
## Section 9. Insurance Guarantee Bond- Ministry of Manpower
We will provide a Letter of Guarantee on Your behalf in lieu of the cash deposit of $5,000 which You are required to deposit with the Ministry of Manpower of Singapore under section 12 of Employment of Foreign Manpower (Work Passes) Regulations or section 21 of Immigration Regulations.

## Section 10. Liability to Third Parties
We will pay up to the Benefit Limit for damages and/or the claimants' costs in respect of:
1. Accidental Death of or Bodily Injury to any person;
2. Accidental damage to material property belonging to any person.

occurring during the Period of Insurance caused by Your Maid in Singapore during the Period of Insurance for which You are legally liable.

We will also pay for the costs and expenses incurred by You and/or Your Maid in conducting Your/her defence with Our written consent.
questions: Under Section 9, how does the provision of a Letter of Guarantee in lieu of the $5,000 cash deposit with the Ministry of Manpower interact with any general exclusions or conditions related to financial guarantees or bonds?

In Section 10, what are the specific types of damages and claimant costs covered for accidental death, bodily injury, and property damage caused by Your Maid, and how do these limits apply during the Period of Insurance?
How does the policy define the scope of legal liability for damages caused by Your Maid in Singapore, and what documentation or proof is required to establish such liability under Section 10?
What are the conditions and limitations on the payment of costs and expenses for conducting a defence for You and/or Your Maid, including the requirement for Our written consent under Section 10?
How does the coverage for accidental damage to material property under Section 10 interact with any general exclusions related to property damage or intentional acts?

In the event that the accidental death or bodily injury occurs outside Singapore, does Section 10 provide coverage, or is it limited strictly to incidents occurring within Singapore during the Period of Insurance?

How does the Letter of Guarantee provided under Section 9 comply with the requirements of section 12 of the Employment of Foreign Manpower (Work Passes) Regulations and section 21 of the Immigration Regulations, and what happens if these regulations change during the Period of Insurance?

If a claim arises from bodily injury caused by Your Maid but the injury is due to a pre-existing medical condition, how does Section 10 address such scenarios in relation to legal liability and benefit limits?
What are the implications if You fail to obtain Our written consent before incurring costs and expenses for the defence of a claim under Section 10, and how does this affect claim eligibility?

How does the policy handle situations where the Ministry of Manpower requires a cash deposit instead of accepting the Letter of Guarantee provided under Section 9, and are there any exclusions or conditions that apply?
Does Section 10 cover damages or claims arising from intentional or criminal acts committed by Your Maid, or are such scenarios excluded under general or section-specific exclusions?
How is the Benefit Limit under Section 10 determined, and does it apply per incident, per person, or as an aggregate limit during the Period of Insurance?
In cases where the accidental damage to material property is to jointly owned property, how does Section 10 determine the extent of coverage and legal liability?

What documentation or evidence is required to support a claim for accidental death or bodily injury under Section 10, and how do these requirements interact with any general policy documentation clauses?

If Your Maid causes accidental damage to property belonging to a third party who is an Immediate Family Member, does Section 10 provide coverage, or are there any exclusions related to family members?
How does the policy address the timing of claims under Section 10, specifically regarding the occurrence of the accident during the Period of Insurance and any reporting deadlines?

Are there any exclusions or limitations in Section 10 related to damages arising from the use of motor vehicles or other machinery by Your Maid, and how do these interact with general policy exclusions?
How does the policy coordinate coverage under Section 10 with any other liability insurance You may hold, particularly in terms of subrogation rights and avoiding double recovery?

What are the consequences if the Letter of Guarantee under Section 9 is revoked or becomes invalid during the Period of Insurance, and how does this affect Your compliance with Ministry of Manpower requirements?
In the event that Your Maid incurs legal costs defending a claim outside Singapore, does Section 10 cover these costs, or is coverage strictly limited to legal expenses incurred within Singapore?
